intro: Acisanthera inundata, commonly known as the water lily of the genus Acisanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae, which includes other aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. Its roots are adapted to aquatic environments, allowing it to thrive in still or slow-moving water. Acisanthera inundata plays a role in water ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
